title: Zamorak Magical Institute

properties.value: The Zamorak Magical Institute (known as the Z.M.I.) is a Zamorakian organisation which specialises in magics and runecraft. Formed after their banishment from the Order of Wizards following claims that they burned down the Wizards' Tower,[1][2] its main goal seems to be to arm Zamorakian magic specialists with runes and to gain access to the rune essence mine,[3] in which they believe that the Order has regained access to it.[4]

The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Zamorak Magical Institute
Zamorak Magical Institute
Released 13 June 2005 (Update)
Also called Z.M.I.
A runecrafter of the Z.M.I. crafts runes at the Zamorakian-controlled Ourania Altar.

The Zamorak Magical Institute (known as the Z.M.I.) is a Zamorakian organisation which specialises in magics and runecraft. Formed after their banishment from the Order of Wizards following claims that they burned down the Wizards' Tower,[1][2] its main goal seems to be to arm Zamorakian magic specialists with runes and to gain access to the rune essence mine,[3] in which they believe that the Order has regained access to it.[4]

They have taken control of the Ourania Cave and the runic altar therein, and have access to a part of the Abyss, where they have created rifts leading directly to temples housing the runic altars.[5] They seem to be active in the greater Varrock area. According to Savant, the Temple Knights suspect this organisation to be responsible for the burning of the Wizards' Tower in decades past and a number of other crimes.

Members[edit | edit source]

  • Dark Mage (Abyss)
  • Mage of Zamorak (Wilderness)
  • Mage of Zamorak (Ourania)
  • Zamorak crafter
  • Zamorak warrior
  • Zamorak ranger
  • Zamorak mage

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Archmage Sedridor, Old School RuneScape. "The wizards who served Zamorak, the evil god of chaos, tried to claim our magical discoveries in his name. They failed, but in retaliation, they burnt the entire tower to the ground."
  2. ↑ Mage of Zamorak, Old School RuneScape. "Naturally, they blamed the Zamorakians. Claimed we intentionally burnt the tower down. After the tower was rebuilt, we were banished from the Order of Wizards and forced underground."
  3. ↑ Abyssal book, Old School RuneScape. "Thanks to the portals, the Abyss has become a runecrafting gold mine, especially when combined with the pouches detailed previously. However, as also noted, lack of access to the lost Rune Essence Mine is preventing us from utilising the Abyss to its full potential."
  4. ↑ Abyssal book, Old School RuneScape. "One recent development of concern in this area is the sudden increase in rune production from the Order of Wizards. Could it be that they have found a way to the Rune Essence Mine themselves?"
  5. ↑ Abyssal book, Old School RuneScape. "While originally only intended as a way for us to access the Abyss, the portal spell soon proved to have some very beneficial side effects. It has also allowed us to open portals to most of the runic altars found across Gielinor."
